Text.title: Setup Projects
Text.desc: This page contains information about setting up various projects.

Text.title: Scroll Links
Text.desc: Use these links to scroll to different parts of the page.

Text.title: How to Install Node.js
Text.desc: How to install Node.js before setting up your project.

Text.title: How to Setup a Vue.js Project
Text.desc: How to setup a Vue.js project that uses Vite.

ScrollLinks.name: How to Setup a Vue Project

SetupNode.instruction: Check if you already have node installed by running the following command in your terminal.
If you don't have Node.js installed on your computer, you can install it by using this link -> https://nodejs.org/en.

SetupVue.instruction: Create a new Vue.js project. If you're prompted to install packages type "y". Replace "your-project-name" with the real name of your project.
Run the application to make sure everything's working. The page should say Vite + Vue.
Install vue-router while in your new project directory
Create the following directories in the src folder.

Code.FormatCode:
mkdir views
  mkdir router
  mkdir utils
Code.CopyCode:
mkdir views
mkdir router
mkdir utils

SetupVue.instruction: Change into the "components" directory then delete the "HelloWorld.vue" component. Then change back into the top-directory of src. Do command + k to clear your terminal after you're done.
Change into the router directory, then create an index.js file

In the index.js file paste the following code. Note that "Home" and "SecondPage" are just variable names. You could write something like the following import statement -> "import home-page from '../views/Home.vue';" and have it still work.
Now open the "main.js" file in the top-most directory of the src folder. Delete the contents of the file and paste in the following code.

Code.FormatCode:
import { createApp } from 'vue'
  import App from './App.vue'
  import router from './router'

  createApp(App).use(router).mount('#app');
Code.CopyCode:
import { createApp } from 'vue'
import App from './App.vue'
import router from './router'

createApp(App).use(router).mount('#app');

SetupVue.instruction: Change out of the router directory and into components directory. Create a file named "RouterBtn.vue".
Paste the following code into "RouterBtn.vue" file.

Code.FormatCode:
<template>
        <router-link :to="path" class="button">
  	  {{ buttonText }}
        </router-link>
  </template>


  <script setup>

  const props = defineProps({
        path: {
  	  type: String,
  	  required: true
        },
        buttonText: {
  	  type: String,
  	  required: true
        }
  });

  </script>


  <style scoped>

  .button {
       display: inline-block;
       padding: 10px 20px;
       color: white;
       background-color: #007bff;
       border: none;
       border-radius: 4px;
       text-align: center;
       text-decoration: none;
       font-size: 16px;
  }

  .button:hover {
       background-color: #0056b3;
  }

  </style>
Code.CopyCode:
<template>
	<router-link :to="path" class="button">
		{{ buttonText }}
	</router-link>
</template>


<script setup>

const props = defineProps({
	path: {
		type: String,
		required: true
	},
	buttonText: {
		type: String,
		required: true
	}
});

</script>


<style scoped>

.button {
	display: inline-block;
	padding: 10px 20px;
	color: white;
	background-color: #007bff;
	border: none;
	border-radius: 4px;
	text-align: center;
	text-decoration: none;
	font-size: 16px;
}

.button:hover {
	background-color: #0056b3;
}

</style>

SetupVue.instruction: Change out of the "components" directory and into the "views" directory and create a file called "Home.vue" and "SecondPage.vue".

Code.FormatCode:
cd ..
  cd views
  touch Home.vue
  touch SecondPage.vue
Code.CopyCode:
cd ..
  cd views
  touch Home.vue
  touch SecondPage.vue

SetupVue.instruction: Paste the following code in the "Home.vue" file.
Paste the following code in the "SecondPage.vue" file.
Go to "App.vue" in the src directory, then delete all the code in it. Copy and paste the following Vue Code in the file.

After you're done, save your code and run it using "npm run dev". I think this should be a good start to your project. Obviously you can delete and modify the files. The example files were just to show you how to set the project up.
